numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Young women reach out to their parents more often than young men.
2. Less than 25 percent of young men visit their parents in person at least once a day or a few times a week.
3. Less than 25 percent of young women visit their parents in person at least once a day or a few times a week.
4. Young women use texts and calls to connect with their parents more often than young men.
5. The difference between young women and young men is larger for texts and calls than for in-person visits.
6. I wonder whether traditional gender stereotypes affect how often a young person reaches out to his or her parents.
7. Society often encourages young men to be independent.
8. Society often discourages young men from asking for help.
9. Society often expects women to lead domestic lives.
10. Society often expects women to lead family-centric lives.
11. I wonder whether this phenomenon has deeper roots.
12. I wonder whether biological instincts differ between men and women.
13. I have a very close relationship with my parents.
14. I am an only child.
15. I am an only daughter.
16. Many family friends of mine are adults.
17. Many family friends of mine have only boys.
18. Some family friends of mine call me an honorary daughter.
19. People frequently mention that I reach out to my parents more than young men do.
20. People frequently say that parenting a girl is very different from parenting a boy.
21. I think that daughters are favorites.
